Stencila for R
  • Home
  • Reference

A R context

An execution context for R code

RContext

Format

R6Class.

Details

In Stencila, a "context" is the thing that executes code for a particular programming language. This is the context for R. It implements the Context API so that it can talk to other parts of the platform, including contexts for other languages, Documents, and Sheets.

new()

Create a new RContext

global

Scope of context is the global environment. Default FALSE

closed

Context is not nested within the global environment. Default FALSE

runCode()

Run R code within the context's scope

code

R code to be executed

options

Any execution options

callCode()

Run R code within a local function scope

code

R code to be executed

args

A list with a data pack for each argument

codeDependencies()

Returns an array of all variable names not declared within the piece of code. This might include global functions and variables used within the piece of code.

code

R code

Examples

context <- RContext$new()
context$runCode('my_var <- 42')
#> $errors
#> NULL
#> 
#> $output
#> NULL
#> 
context$runCode('my_var')
#> $errors
#> NULL
#> 
#> $output
#> $output$type
#> [1] "flt"
#> 
#> $output$format
#> [1] "text"
#> 
#> $output$content
#> [1] "42"
#> 
#> 
context$callCode('my_var / 7')
#> $errors
#> $errors$`1`
#> [1] "object 'my_var' not found"
#> 
#> 
#> $output
#> NULL
#> 
context$callCode('x * 2', list(x=pack(2)))
#> $errors
#> NULL
#> 
#> $output
#> $output$type
#> [1] "flt"
#> 
#> $output$format
#> [1] "text"
#> 
#> $output$content
#> [1] "4"
#> 
#> 
context$callCode('plot(1,1)')
#> $errors
#> NULL
#> 
#> $output
#> $output$type
#> [1] "plot"
#> 
#> $output$format
#> [1] "png"
#> 
#> $output$content
#> [1]
